title: Killeen 2-year-old in critical condition from gunshot
content:
A 2-year-old Killeen boy is in critical condition after accidentally shooting himself Friday morning, police said.
The mother called police at 8:43 a.m. and said she heard a loud bang and found the boy suffering from a gunshot wound to his left thigh and chest, police said.
Emergency paramedics immediately took the child to McLane Children’s Scott & White Hospital in Temple, where he underwent surgery to remove the bullet, police said.
The boy’s 1-year-old and 7-year-old sisters have been removed from the family and placed in the custody of Child Protective Services while detectives investigate the case, police said. While conducting the initial investigation, officers removed several weapons from the residence on the 800 block of Kern Road.
In a statement, the Killeen Police Department reminded residents to keep weapons locked and out of reach of children at all times.
